I based this on a Maangchi recipe but deviated with some of the toppings. It has braised pork belly, mini kielbasa, spam, hot dog, sous vide chicken, fish balls, fish cake, king mushrooms, enoki mushrooms, tofu, boiled eggs, ramen, udon, kimchi, watercress.

WRITING.TEXT: Filling should be fully precooked ahead of time
Also I put some cotija cheese in it! Go crazy

FOR THE DOUGH 4 cups all-purpose flour, plus more for dusting 2 teaspoons baking powder 2 teaspoons salt 1/2 cup (1 stick) cold butter, cut into small pieces 1 cup cold water 1 large egg, lightly beaten with 1 tablespoon water (do not beat until ready to bake)
Make the dough: In a bowl, combine flour, baking powder, and salt. Using your fingers, cut in butter until mixture is crumbly. Add just enough cold water so dough comes together. Roll out and cut rounds. You can crimp them with a fork after putting filling in and then use a egg wash on them and bake at 400F for about 30-40 min until the color you like
After doing this though it is much easier to use frozen Goya premade empanada dough or even puff pastry.
Red bell pepper, green olive and a little bit of tomato
I use this filling recipe. It makes more filling than the shell recipe I posted in the other reply http://www.marthastewart.com/341017/blueberry-tart
Or you can cook and refrigerate the rice the night before.
Yes. Heat some berries (frozen or fresh) with cornstarch, sugar, and lemon juice and lemon zest and save some fresh berries to spread over the top

I use this recipe which is super easy. The crust ends up like a butter cookie which is good by itself. This can be filled with anything really
1 1/3cups (6 2/3 ounces) all-purpose flour 5 tablespoons (2 1/4 ounces) sugar 1/2 teaspoon salt 10 tablespoons unsalted butter, melted
1. FOR THE CRUST: Adjust 1 oven rack to lowest position and second rack 5 to 6 inches from broiler element. Heat oven to 350 degrees. Whisk flour, sugar, and salt together in bowl. Add melted butter and stir with wooden spoon until dough forms. Using your hands, press two-thirds of dough into bottom of 9-inch tart pan with removable bottom. Press remaining dough into fluted sides of pan (use a measuring cup or other straight sided thing to press the dough against the sides while using thumb to press down the top). Press and smooth dough with your hands to even thickness. Place pan on wire rack set in rimmed baking sheet and bake on lowest rack, until crust is deep golden brown and firm to touch, 30 to 35 minutes, rotating pan halfway through baking. Set aside until ready to fill. ( I use the measuring cup to push the sides back up a couple of times during baking, or it will fall down and not be as tall)
All blueberries with a hint of lemon!

I'll deliver for tree fiddy

Marinate the chicken wings in whatever you like but I went with onion powder, garlic powder, soy sauce and salt. Then coat with some corn starch and a little oil. I used the air fryer (360 for 15 minutes) but you could shallow fry as well till it's crisp enough for you. The sauce is fresh minced garlic, scallions, and jalapeos toasted in oil. Toss sauce together with wings and add more salt and pepper.
I seriously love my air fryer! It works really well for things that have light dryer coatings. It does take up a lot of space but it's worth it.

WRITING.TITLE: [homemade] salt and pepper chicken wings in air fryer
